attributes.action: Protect Barony Park in Nantwich from travellers parking illegally on it.
attributes.additional_details:
This happens multiple times a year. During which time residents are unable to walk their dogs or use the park 
Nantwich is currently investing in a lot of new houses near reaseheath, what kind of image does it give to potential buyers moving to the area that the only nearby recreational park is being abused constantly by these trespassers? 
please protect our park from being used in this way
attributes.background: I and many other residents are fed up travellers parking caravans illegally on barony park in nantwich. This renders the park unusable for dog walkers and kids. We want a small fence, mounds, posts, ditches or similar to stop them gaining access to the park.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local police and your local council.
	
You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
